Dear Valued Member of the Year.

By unanimous vote Miss Margaret Huber of the FHA State office, and 1951 chairman of the USDA Employee Welfare Committee, was selected to receive a certificate of Merit for her outstanding contribution to the USDA Club through her work in securing discounts for USDA Club members. This Woman of the Year" honor was bestowed only after careful study and selection by the award committee and the Board of Directors.

For the past several months Miss Huber has been busily negotiating with Dallas firms to secure discounts on merchandise purchased by USDA members. Her efforts have met with considerable success, and as a result employees of the Department may purchase a large variety of articles for themselves, their families, and their homes, at substantial savings ranging from 5 to 50 per cent. A Pledge For Americans

Because the grandeur of America thrills me with pride, and her nobility fills me with humility and reverence; because nobody has ever discovered a better way of life since Time began, I dedicate myself to keeping her strong. In addition to the discounts, Miss Huber was also instrumental in providing for the screening of two film presentations of the American Cancer Society to women members of the club. These were titled "Traitor Within", and "Brust Self-Examination", and were made for the purpose of detecting cancer symptoms in the earlier and more curable stages.

A native of Dallas, Margaret graduated from Forest Avenue High school, and attended North Texas State College at Denton. She has been with the Department of Agriculture since the old Texas Rural Community days back in 1957. Successive steps were the old Rosterletten Airport station, the regional office of the Farm Security Administration, and finally, the state office of the Farmers Home Administration. The district office of the Farm Security Administration was in El Paso, Texas.

The Editor of its congratulators to Miss Huber and a "well done" to the Committee for their fine choice.

MAN OF THE MONTH SELECTION... (From page 1)

was made Chief Personnel Officer the following year. Bolish served a hitch in the Navy during the last war and then returned to Dallas, taking the job of Area Personnel Officer with FMA. He was given two additional titles in December when he was chosen USDA Club President for 1952, and also elected as chairman of the Dallas-Fort Worth Federal Personnel Council.

From the foregoing it appears that Mr. Bolish will be a busy man for the year 1952 but his friend says he thrives on work. The News echoes their congratulations and best wishes.
